intro: Ctenodon genistoides var. genistoides, commonly known as the yellow flame tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its striking yellow to orange flowers that bloom in clusters during the dry season. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, woody pods that contain seeds. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental species. Its rapid growth and showy blooms make it a valuable addition to gardens and landscapes.
